title: Quarto Wiki
text:
Tip



Maybe put things you often google here.




Handled via Quarto homebrew cask
# first time
brew install --cask quarto
# update
brew upgrade --cask quarto

2022 Reproducible Authoring with Quarto - Mine √áetinkaya-Rundel
Talk given at 2022 Toronto Workshop for Reproducibility
üì∫ Link to YouTube Recording

01:18 RMarkdown -> Quarto + live demo
04:16 RStudio Visual Editor ‚Äì removes some cognitive load of learning RMarkdown + coding, forward slash ‚Äú/‚Äù to - insert anything
05:35 Quarto can render RMarkdown even if you just change the file extension
06:10 Shared features ‚Äì output: ‚Äì> format:, live rendering, citations (from DOI search!), in-line R code
12:20 Quarto specific ‚Äì YAML style chunk options (great for alt text) but mixed style works!; global chunk - options in yaml header; code-link: true
16:18 Visual Editor helps with avoiding minutiae of markdown syntax ‚Äì alt-text, captions, links, tab-sets
18:13 Change output from html to reveal.js slides ‚Äì `chalkboard: true` adds annotation tool; built-in - presentation tools
20:14 more Quarto features‚Äì R and python, support in other text editors, projects
24:15 Q&A



R Markdown Advanced Tips to Become a Better Data Scientist & RStudio Connect | With Tom Mock

documenting different models or datasets

41:20 - Reference named chunks from .R files - (knitr::read_chunk())
43:00 - Child Documents (reuse content, conditional - inclusion, {blastula} email)
47:07 Templating (don‚Äôt repeat yourself)
47:38 - rmarkdown::render() with params, looping through - different param combinations
49:30 - loop templates within a single document
50:40 - 04-templating/ live code demo
54:37 - {whisker} vs {glue} ‚Äì {{logic-less}} vs {logic - templating}

57:49 RMarkdown + Rstudio Connect
1:00:41 Follow-up Reading and resources
1:04:49 Q&A - {shiny} apps, {webshot2} for screenshots of - html, reading in multiple .R files, best practice for producing MSoffice files, {blastula}

For me:

knit with params to document different model/hyper-parameter options 
interactive graphic for exploring Panel Maps with {crosstalk}
Using R & Python in Rmarkdown (and hence Quarto)

title: Ideas
text:
To use quarto templates: quarto use template github/repo



Had an idea about using quarto website as a research compendium for tracking:

thesis plan
supervisor meeting notes
random thoughts and ideas
literature summaries
glossary, references

It would be extra cool if you could serve the static site semi-privately so only specific people can see it. 11¬†try this tutorial



Some great resources:

Community (2022)
CRAN Task View: Reproducible Research




Community, The Turing Way. 2022. The Turing Way: A Handbook for Reproducible, Ethical and Collaborative Research. Zenodo. https://doi.org/10.5281/ZENODO.7625728.

title: Meetings
text:
To add meeting notes, just add a new file in this folder with following YAML:
title: "Numbats Hackathon Wrap-Up"
date: 2022-02-24
description: "Sharing all the cool things we made"
attendees: ""
location: "San Remo, VIC"


   
     
     
       Order By
       Default
         
          Date - Oldest
        
         
          Date - Newest
        
         
          Title

title: Bibliography
text: To collect all the references that appear on any page in this website, this document has the following YAML options:

title: Bibliography
text:
